questions.question: The soldiers killed the terrorists by acting ...................... tips from the villagers.
questions.description: To act on is to take action on the basis of information received.

questions.question: The children acted ................................ the story of Snow White on stage.
questions.description: To act out is to perform with actions and gestures.

questions.question: The car has started acting ....................... again. It doesn't start.
questions.description: To act up is to behave badly.

questions.question: Your explanations just don't add ...................
questions.description: When things add up, they make sense.

questions.question: Mutton or beef does not agree .................................. me.
questions.description: If something does not agree with you, it has a negative impact on you.

questions.question: Commercials aimed ........................ children must be banned.
questions.description: To aim at is to target.

questions.question: You must never answer ........................... your elders.
questions.description: To answer back is to reply rudely to an elderly person.

questions.question: You will never manage to argue me .......................
questions.description: To argue somebody down is to beat them in an argument.

questions.question: Her children live abroad but they ask ..................... her every day.
questions.description: To ask after somebody is to inquire about their health.

questions.question: If you like her, why don't you ask her ..................... for lunch?
questions.description: To ask somebody over is to invite them.

questions.question: The brave villagers forced the invaders to back ..................................
questions.description: To back off is to retreat.

questions.question: She had promised to lend me some money but backed .................. at the last moment.
questions.description: To back out of a promise is to fail to keep it.
